question_bank.veneration: In the temple, visitors spoke in whispers and bowed before the statue. Their actions showed deep _____ rather than casual respect.
question_bank.insolence: The intern rolled his eyes and interrupted the attending mid-sentence. His _____ shocked the entire team because it was openly rude.
question_bank.obstinate: Even after three independent tests proved the result, he refused to change his mind. He remained _____, clinging to his original view.
question_bank.authenticated: The museum requested laboratory analysis and verified records before displaying the manuscript. Only after it was _____ did they label it genuine.
question_bank.equanimity: When the experiment failed in front of the audience, she did not panic or lash out. She handled the setback with remarkable _____.
question_bank.pernicious: The policy sounded harmless at first, but it slowly undermined trust and safety over time. Its effects were _____, damaging in a subtle, lasting way.
question_bank.cultivate: To build strong trainees, the program tries to _____ curiosity and discipline. The goal is to develop those qualities intentionally over time.
question_bank.civil: They strongly disagreed about the plan, but the discussion stayed _____. No one shouted or insulted the other side.
question_bank.tactful: He rejected the proposal without embarrassing the junior colleague who suggested it. His response was firm but _____.
question_bank.ornate: The hall was covered with gold trim, elaborate carvings, and decorative arches. The style was clearly _____ rather than plain.
question_bank.submission: After weeks of revisions, the team prepared the final manuscript for _____. They were ready to send it formally to the journal for review.
question_bank.inconsequential: They argued for an hour about the font size on a slide. In the grand scheme, the issue was _____.
question_bank.chaos: When the power failed during the storm, schedules collapsed and instructions contradicted each other. The clinic descended into _____.
question_bank.initiation: Before she could access the lab, she completed safety training and received her badge. This onboarding marked her official _____.
question_bank.anachronistic: The film set in 1800 showed characters using smartphones. The detail was glaringly _____ for the historical period.
question_bank.replicate: To confirm the finding, the lab asked an independent team to _____ the experiment. They needed the same result under the same conditions.
question_bank.affluent: The neighborhood is visibly _____, with private schools and high-end homes. Residents generally have significant financial resources.
question_bank.gregarious: He chats easily with strangers and thrives at crowded gatherings. His _____ personality makes him naturally social.
question_bank.reclusive: After the scandal, the author avoided interviews and stopped appearing in public. She became increasingly _____.
question_bank.ethics: The committee reviewed consent procedures and data privacy before approving the study. They focused on research _____.
question_bank.patronizing: He praised her idea with a smirk and spoke as if she were a child. The tone was _____, not genuinely respectful.
question_bank.censure: The board voted to formally criticize the official for misusing funds. They decided to _____ him in a public statement.
question_bank.satire: The cartoon mocked corruption by exaggerating politiciansâ€™ promises to absurd extremes. It used _____ to criticize through humor.
question_bank.abstruse: The textbook chapter was so _____ that even experts had to reread each paragraph. The writing was difficult to understand, not merely advanced.
question_bank.stratagem: To distract the guards, they staged a loud argument near the front gate. The diversion was a deliberate _____.
